This good news message is according to the 'revelation of the mystery' (Rom. 16:25) given to Paul (Gal. 1:11+12), and the 'wisdom given him.' 2Pet. 3:14-16 (15). Our gospel is veiled to those who are perishing. 2Cor. 4:3+4 (See 2Thes. 2:7-12).

The most common counterfeit to Paul's gospel is the message of Christ with the addition of repentance and water baptism. Satan has taken the precepts of #1 and #2 above and combined them into a heavenly way to send men straight to hell. Obedience to a false gospel message spells doom for those deceived by this form of wickedness. Read the words of 2Thes. 2:7-12 very carefully and note the effects of the 'deluding influence' of verse 10.
 
 4. Everlasting Gospel. "And I saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having an eternal gospel to preach to those who live on the earth, and to every nation and tribe and tongue and people." Rev. 14:6. In the future of this planet and beyond, there shall be an eternal good news message for the obedience of all.  The only two good news messages to see sins forgiven in the entire Bible to date are the Gospel of the Kingdom (#1) and the Gospel of the Grace of God (#2). The 'another gospel' (#3) represents all false good news messages. The Eternal Gospel (#4) of Revelation 14 is still future.
